text:
Chains hang from every arch. Some still drip with dark ichor, others hum with whispers too old to comprehend. The bones of giants dangle from rusted manacles, and among them sway smaller forms—priests, kings, perhaps even gods. You pass through slowly, reverently.

The dead watch, but do not speak. A single chain falls before you, its links glowing faintly. When you touch it, pain flares—not from the flesh, but from memory. You recall a pyre you built, a body you burned, and a promise you broke. Then the chain turns to ash.
lore: The Chained Dead were once called the Unyielding—heroes bound to the First Flame to keep it alive. When the world began to forget, they were left to rot in sacred prisons. Only a bearer of broken flame can release them.
